meta.description: A human-readable page about the privacy on www.dear-charlote.com.

ross.p: This page is about all the creepy tracking that this site does. I'm hoping to make it human readable, which presumably means that it won't stand up in a court of law, because it's not written in Latin.

content.p: My hosting company, One.com, monitors some basic information about each visitor, based on what are called referer [] fields. This tracking doesn't use cookies but also doesn't provide me with a lot of detail about you, the reader of this site.

While this information isn't hugely useful or detailed, it also is quite difficult for you to block, unfortunately. But it would be next to impossible for me to identify anyone using this information (your might have more luck).

Up until April 2018, I used Google Analytics to track users more comprehensively on the site. Then I got bored, and never checked it. Google Analytics is complicated, isn't it? was the nudge I needed to get rid of all that nonsense. This still means that Google are tracking you in loads of ways across other sites which also use Google Analytics. If this bothers you, you can download a browser add-on which lets you opt-out of such foolishness. I, for one, would completely understand, you proud Internet Ninja.
I'm not interested in making money out of this site. I hope this doesn't change, and make me look foolish in the future.

Because I embed content from third-party services such as Imgur, Disqus and Soundcloud, they'll do all kinds of creepy tracking themselves. Sorry about this. In order to speed up page load and to allow you to opt out of sending your clicks there, I've hidden Disqus behind a clicky toggle thingLook! It's right down thereâ†“. Before you click on that button, nothing will be loaded from Disqus, so no third-party tracking from them will take place.
